column3: This place brings to life the teachings of the Bhagavad Gita in a very simple way that any layperson can relate to, thereby making it a lot less daunting to understand the book. Highly recommended if you‚Äôre in La.
I am not a fan of Japanese films and anime. But friends dragged on). I liked the dioramas as alive). Makes me think.

The Bhagavad Gita Museum was an in depth and beautiful learning experience. One of the most amazing museum visits I have had. The temple is also beautiful and the meal at Govinda's restaurant is delicious. Thank you Radha Krishna Das for being our guide!

The dioramas are gorgeous, and feel both very modern but nostalgic at the same time. Very educational, thought provoking, and the staff is super friendly and helpful. A great way to spend a pensive hour in the afternoon.
So amazing. Funnest thing I have done with my friends in LA. So cool. So profound. Out of this world
I was not expecting how great of an experience this was! Very great, would recommend to check it out!
An incredible experience from start to finish. A beautiful temple and museum, staff were very welcoming and helpful and food was amazing.

My teen wanted to spend the day with me. Shopping or spa was too boring so i looked on google for a museum. This came up and i thought i should try it. Something different and interesting. It end up being a pleasant surprise of how beautiful and how inspiring this place was. Loved every moment and time well spend at bargain price. Make sure to visit the temple and the restaurant. Food was delicious
Beautifully detailed dioramas and very informative and captivating commentary. Would highly recommend for anyone in LA.
Had a great time at the museum, very informative and engaging. The museum is divided into sections with voice narration guiding you throughout the experience.
Hare Krishna!!! Wonderful exhibits with wonderful people, many thanks ‚ô°‚ô°‚ô° a truly immersive Bhagavad Gita experience üôèüèΩüôèüèΩüôèüèΩ
Excellent! Beautiful animatronics and models illustrate the Bhagavat Gita and the narrations explain the philosophy succinctly . Please check it out. Hare Krishna!
Wasn‚Äôt expecting this amazing experience. Thank you to all the devotees who worked so hard. A moment to remember in my life, thank you. Haribol!

The museum is well maintained. The soundtrack is of good quality.I felt as if after watching an entertaining yet thought-provoking movie. I have been there twice now. My friend brought my ticket thinking I may like it on our trip to Los Angeles. I actually enjoyed it even the second time.

column2: Excellent place to see. Must visit.
column3: I visited this place on a Saturday and there was no one at the museum due early morning hours. There is one number displayed at the entrance. I was about to call and before I could call, a gentleman came there who opened the door even when it was still an hour for its door to open as per their rules. He was very kind and assisted me very well. Music, light effects and beauty of the sculpture is awesome. I was impressed. It was just $10 entry fee and in my opinion it is too less to maintain such wonderful facility. Once you get in , be quiet and stand near lights near to floor and close the doors properly. Also listen to each sentence carefully. You will find yourself enlightened once you come out in 45 minutes. Must visit place in LA.
A bit surreal, a bit trippy. Kids were somewhat entertained, informed. I appreciated the craftsmanship and work involved. Experience takes about an hour. I recommend a visit for every LA person.
I loved this very unique museum that clearly explained the main points of the Bhagavad-gita via visual experience!

I went in with no expectations but came out totally impressed. There was such attention to detail in the setting up of the diorama's scenes. The animatronics felt equal to Disneyland. They were much more lifelike than you'd think they'd be for a temple museum. The director of the museum was gracious and kind, answering all of our questions. The temple itself was beautiful. So make time to go in there, and also make time to have lunch at the $8 buffet. They had enough vegan options for me; the potato salad is definitely worth going back for in itself.

Wonderful display and re-enactment of the Gita. The essence of the Gita was explained so beautifully. The Diorama was done so well. You would not believe it was created 40 years ago. It is as well created as anything that is produced currently! The technology used and the beautiful art work and animation is beyond it‚Äôs time. They were way beyond there times when they put this museum together! I highly recommend everyone go experience it for yourselves. You will be enlighten and uplifted!

Such a lovely insightful tour on the Bhagvad Gita! Would highly recommend and suggest to anyone in Los Angeles to go to this. Even if you know about Indian vedic history. It is awsome and surreal to see this museam. Loved my time here. Thank you so much!
Best museum I‚Äôve been to so far. They had all types of cool things most definitely come and check it out.
This was so lit. I highly recommend to anyone looking for a good time. I would spend 100 dollars on this any day
Really cool graphics, the music definitely added to the experience. I would highly recommend for anyone to visit.

AMAZING!!! I was expecting to learn about some interesting facts of the history of the Bhagavad-Gita and Hare Krishna movement. What I actually experienced was totally above and beyond expectations. This immersive walk through puts you right into the heart of Srila Prabhupada (ISKCON Founder) and the teachings of the vedas. What I really enjoyed was how well everything is explained from the history to the philosophy. Great Experience overall recommend for anyone interested in learning about the Hare Krishnas or just want to experience an incredible spiritual culture!

column2: Amazing exposure to spiritual text the Gita
column3: Truly wonderful experience taking the private tour with thought provoking questions about human existence

We were awestruck and bewildered by the grandeur and intricacies of each exhibit at the Bhagvad -Gita Diorama museum! An enthralling experience! Would recommend each one to visit L.A specially to see these exhibits! It appears as if the pages of the Bhagvad Gita come to life! I have been to many museums in the past; but this one is definitely going to be my all-time favorite! Its been well maintained too, and constantly refurbished!

column2: The entire essence of Bhagwad Gita in 45 mins - visual treat!!!
column3: If you are in LA or visiting LA, don't miss visiting this. We just got lucky to find this. First of all, the key message shared here is the highest truth and perfect knowledge that everyone should know. Secondly, the museum is done with the highest quality diorama art and brings the message to life. I am going to share with everyone I know to go visit this place. It will be worth your time and money and most importantly, it can positively change your life.
Recommended for all...a fascinating learning experience...the food at Govinda‚Äôs was excellent and the tour and museum were exceptional.
We had a very pleasant guide through the museum. He was happy to answer any questions & a happy person to be around.
There were four in our group. We ate lunch, saw the temple, and took the tour. It was wonderful! I'd love to visit again.

column2: Hare Krishna :) Thank you for your fun and blissfull museum.
column3: Seeing A.C.Bhaktivedanta Swami Prabhupada, Krishna & Arjuna and the stages of human life was fun and it showcases the philosophy and how is that our soul is so special and beautiful.

The Diorama Museum of Bhagavad Gita in LA was quite impressive for the realistic quality of all of the parts of the exhibit. The tour was narrated with a recording of quotes from the Bhagavad Gita accompanied by some original music and classical music excerpts. Different parts of the exhibit were illuminated and even moved at the appropriate moments. I highly recommend this exhibit for Hare Krishna devotees and also other seekers of transcendental knowledge.
Great museum, it is small but worth the visit. Price is about $10 for a self guided tour. Worth the visit if you are in the area, follow this up with a visit to Govinda‚Äôs for lunch.

Amazing place, must visit in LA. This museum filled my heart with joy and devotion. It walks you through different stages of life and tells you how bhagavatgita can help you in your day to day life... it has small charge of $10 which is more than worth it. It is like a donation for this great order of ISKON saints so I don't mind paying that price....Loved it totally.

column2: A fascinating look at the Bhagavad-gita
column3: My kids and I had a wonderful time at this museum. The displays were very interesting and I felt that I had a good sense of what the Bhagavad-gita was about afterward. We also went to the vegan restaurant next door. It‚Äôs an all you can eat buffet. Very tasty. Drinks and dessert are a separate cost though.

This museum is very educational and it's such a fun time. I'm glad that I made my way over to see this amazing spectacular display. If you live in LA or visiting LA I totally recommend checking out this Museum it will teach you so much about how to live life happily and the teachings of the Bhagavad Gita and also Swami Prabhupada. I have been in there twice already and I just want to go again and again. The people and the environment there is very friendly. Cant wait! You should check it out!

I can‚Äôt believe this was my first visit. I can‚Äôt wait to come back. The museum was incredible with stunningly beautiful depictions and great knowledge to share. The message was received, and I‚Äôve left feeling inspired. So grateful to have had this experience. Also, a big thank you to the staff for being so warm and welcoming.

I came here for a school project and I wasn't expecting much but I am pleasantly surprised! The dioramas were beautifully detailed and the narration was so informative! The service was awesome, I told the worker (I forgot to ask his name) I was working on a project and he provided me with some resources to use for it! I highly recommend visiting this museum if you're in LA or curious about the Bhagavad-gita!

column2: A very fascinating way to summarize Bhagavat Gita
column3: The museum had all the gross and subtle elements of Gita packed into a journey of 45 minutes, with audio and visual effects.It is definitely a must visit for all visitors to LA. I would highly recommend it.It is a step by step guided tour to the most innermost and deep understanding which we can gain from our most revered scripture, the Bhagavat Gita. So don't miss it.

Myself and my son(5yrs) visited this museum recently. It was a very wonderful experience. It has depicted a several important philosophies of bagavat gita in a very nice way. It helps my kid to understand some basic principles of bagavat gita. It helps understanding soul trans migration, sense-mind-intelligence-soul, paramatma in everyone's heart, qualities that leads to salvation and lower planets and much more. This museum definitely helps my kid to remember these philosophies and can relate it to bagavat gita slokas. Kudos to the devotees who made it well.

column2: Make sure you Gita ticket immediately!
column3: Fantastic experience, anyone with an interest in spirituality or theology generally will get a lot out of this. I left feeling genuinely inspired, there's a huge amount of work and great artistry that has gone into this exhibit and the general concepts contained will leave you reflecting deeply about life. Highly recommended!

column2: Very interesting way to bring Bhagavad Gita to live!
column3: Must visit place. Its a very entertaining and educational experience especially for children. We went there with our 2 children who really enjoyed the experience. A nice way to introduce them to spirituality through sight and sounds. The dioramas are very elaborate and exquisitely done.Overall, a must-do on a trip to LA.

Loved it! So happy we went. Anyone interested in spiritual philosophy, particularly those teachings in Bhagavad gita should visit the diorama exhibit! I was familiar with the teachings, but to see it come to life was truly magnificent! If you are in Los Angeles you should go!

Hare Krishna!More than anything in Los Angeles, I was too much fascinated by Bhagwad Gita Diorama. Many thanks to devotees for making this and giving opportunity to everyone to experience this transcendental pleasure. The way it is organized, sound system and specially the Designing are awesome. I was very much amazed by Universal Form of Supreme Lord. I highly recommend to visit. Thank you! Hari Bol!

column2: A valuable treasure at Culver city, LA
column3: It gives the required idea of topmost understanding of oneself, self realization, taught in just a span of 45 minutes with the most beautiful heart touching sculptures, light effects and an educative sound. Thank you for this beautiful set up. It is a hidden treasure to the world. They need to know about this.

The museum is a must see. The tour lasts about 40 minutes. You walk through darkened hallways as each diorama is brought to life with lighting and a narrator capturing the main teachings of the Gita. The level of detail in the diorama is truly beautiful.

The story of the Bhagavad-Gita unfolds before your eyes as you are led through dark hallways by the voice of the narrator. He reveals each beautifully crafted exhibit which explain many of the tenets of Krishna‚Äôs teachings.Well worth it! If you are in LA and interested in this kind of thing or just want to see a great diorama definitely don‚Äôt miss this one!
It‚Äôs really nice to visit the museum and well established visuals to explain about god avatars. Thank you very much for providing beautiful content.

This museum is a beautiful little treasure! The dioramas are incredible and the audio and lighting are all really cool! I went with a group of friends including a friend's young daughter and everyone loved it. I loved it so much, i went back again the very next day to bring more friends to see it.
The museum is a must visit. It will truly leave you awestruck and will provide you an experience which you never had before. Really amazing!

I went to the museum without knowing what to expect exactly.Parking: there is street parking, which was quite busy on a saturday. However if you walked a bit further there were plenty of parking spaces.The museum itself: Entrace fee is 10$ and for this price you get 45 minutes of outstanding dioramas explaning the story of the bhagavad gita. The dioramas have completely been restored in 2016 and look amazing! The storytelling is also conducted very nicely. I am not a very religious person but even I was intrigued.The staff was also extremely friendly.I highly recommend visiting this place when you are in LA. We did a road trip through the west coast of USA and this was definitely one of the highlights!

column2: Amazing and a truly blissful experience.
column3: We went as a group of 7 people from San Jose. It was an amazing experience and we were completely mesmerized by the blissful experience out there. I would strongly recommend to anyone who visit ISKCON Los Angeles.
Gita museum is a must visit place. Had a very pleasant and informative time in there, totally forgot about the outside world for 45 min. Even my 3 year and 8 year old girls enjoyed a lot.
Such a lovely place, where Krishna's teachings of the Gita come to life!A great way to start your year!

A superbly curated collection of dioramas and animatronics that explain the Bhagavad Gita (the holy book of the Hare Krishna religion). Filled with insights and notions of what it is to be human (on a core level), the separation/distinction of body and soul, and how to live life as a beneficent and enlightened being. This museum is a must for all... no matter what your beliefs are (or if you have none at all)... Amazing!

column2: Artistic; Profound messages of Vedanta; Suited for both adults and kids
column3: My family (including a 4 and 6 year old) attended the museum as our single stop in Los Angeles.The diorama and storyline is well thought out, poignant in meaning and cleanly ties the messages of the Gita to our daily lives.My young kids didn't understand everything but they were engaged and asked lots of questions afterwards. There was nothing in here that was frightening or not age appropriate.Be prepared for followups (and self-introspection) once you leave.

I totally recommend this museum, the ambient is perfect and caching, the sounds, lights, showrooms, and arts are totally enjoyable and caching. I would really recommend you to pay it a visit if you are in LA! ;)

column2: A Great Intro to the Bhagavad Gita
column3: Wonderful place to visit. Gives a very clear introduction to the Bhagavad Gita and the message behind it. You'll spend about an hour in here. There is an excellent restaurant next door that has extremely good food!Upstairs from the restaurant is a gift store that is completely filled with items that everyone would enjoy!!

column2: Astonishing artwork and very accurate depiction of the Bhagavad Gita message.
column3: I had a very enjoyable experience here. The artwork of each diorama was so descriptive and unique,and each diorama was so mesmerizing and immersive as the combination of music and the image and message each diorama was portraying was breathtaking and left me in awe.I have never seen something so wonderful that depicted the goals of mankind.I would recommend this museum to anyone living in or visiting the Los Angeles area

An absolutely breathtaking experience. Experience the Bhagavad Gita come to life. The multimedia experience was so emersive and professional. A must see for anyone visiting this iconic temple of Iskcon.

Impressive setup for this small museum. It's a 45 minute light and sound tour of dioramas which not just explains origin of 'Gita' but even what makes Gita Gita. And as I myself am not a religious person, I would suggest other athiests and agnostics to also check out this place.

column2: Extremely interesting... and a lot of fun!
column3: My niece worked in Culver City and came across the Bhagavad-gita Museum. She immediately thought of me, since I've always been interested in Eastern philosophy. When I came to visit for the holidays, she took me to the museum as a holiday gift. What a great time!I had a cursory familiarity with Hindu philosophy, and the museum provided a lot of detail that I was not familiar with. I found the information about A. C. Bhaktivedanta Swami Prabhupada, and George Harrison's interest in his philosophy, particularly interesting.There's a lot to absorb, and I was so busy taking pictures of the incredibly detailed dioramas, that I wasn't able to fully concentrate during my first trip through the museum, so I'm planning another visit soon.I also added it to my list in Atlas Obscura (which has a great list of interesting locations around the world).This is definitely one of the most interesting museums I've ever been in - highly recommended!

It was our first trip to Bhagavad Gita museum. The museum is small but different than traditional museums. The multimedia show is impressive and provides a good perspective about Bhagwad Geeta. We really enjoyed our visit to the temple. The museum is rather small and can only accommodate 5-6 people, therefore it is important to book the trip. Overall, we had a very enjoyable experience. Definitely a must for someone who is keen to understand Hinduism.

Not long ago I was a former division I athlete turned professional filmmaker, born of a wealthy family with a beautiful girlfriend (and prospective future wife) whose family was worth billions. I had it ‚Äúall‚Äù in the material sense. The American Dream... but it wasn‚Äôt enough. Because it never is. In October 2018 I consumed an entire mason jar amount of psilocybin mushrooms and was catapulted into a two-month long roller coaster ride where I experienced miracles by the grace God and the hells courtesy of the feverish material energy that I now know to be ‚ÄúYogamƒÅyƒÅ‚Äù. For two months I was lost without a paddle, being thrashed against the jagged rocks of the entropy rapids. I thought it would never end. Then one day while visiting the Griffith Observatory, I was pulled toward a sign reading ‚ÄúFree Meditation Books‚Äù. Up until that point I had been buying three books a day on Amazon, searching for the answers to my spiritual logjam, praying that the turmult might come to an end. My saving grace came on that day on the high mountain above LA in the form of the Bagavad Gita. The nice man behind the book stand handed it to me and invited me to a free Sunday feast at the New Dwarka temple where the Bagavad Gita Museum is located. Having come from a background in aesthetics, I can honestly say I have never seen such a wonder that is the Gita Museum (and hiding in such inconspicuous of places to boot!) I have already seen the dioramas four times in three weeks and each time I receive some new spiritual realization for myself in addition to it flooring the person who Is with me experiencing it for the first time. Whether you are a fellow traveler on your own spiritual parh, an admirer of transcendental storytelling, or just someone looking to fill your time while traveling through LA, your journey will best served with a trip to the Bagavad Gita Dioramma Museum. Hare Krsna!

This is a good place for someone who is not yet initiated the world of Bhagavadgita. The multi media show is quite impressive and grand. The place is small and only limited people ( may be 5-6) can actually stand in the corridor in front of the multimedia presentation. So you need to book your slots during the ticket purchase online and stick to it. This explains the basics of soul and its difference from the physical body. It explains the gist of Hindu philosophy which seeks freedom from the continuous life and death. It explains how you can get liberated from this vicious cycle. It also conveys how every creature on this planet is here because of its past deeds and how the progression towards higher forms of life and eventually to human life( highest form of life) is achieved. The temple adjoining the museum is a nice place to visit and experience it. The vegan restaurant adjoining the museum ( Get a n option to book a buffet with a $5 discount when you book tickets) is a fantastic place. This offers excellent and tasty Indian Vegan buffet with good options with a dessert as well. This place is a hit among the local residents , as they kept trickling in hordes for the buffet or the takeaways. Go ahead and get yourself this experience of a different philosophy of life.
It was my first trip to LA, California. before the trip, I had searched about Bhagavad Gita museum. The museum was small but different than tradition museums..must visit this place if you are in LA.

column2: Very well done exhibit, teaches religion
column3: This odd little museum is next door to the Hare Krishna temple in Culver City. You pay your fee, and the staff escorts you into the first dark room and begins the automated exhibit. Each diorama has lights and narration, teaching principles of Hinduism and the story of the Bhagavad-Gita. You will learn how Hindus view incarnated life and the purpose of the soul, along with the story of Arjuna and Krishna. As each diorama's presentation ends, you move to the next. This involves some opening and closing of doors in dark spaces. If you have poor night vision, you may wish to have a small light handy to help you move through the exhibit.My investigations of Hinduism ended long ago, and i have for many years been happy following another faith. I went with family members who are non-practicing Christians. Aunt and I were quite impressed with it, Uncle was not too keen on the religious messages. Be clear before you go that the purpose of the museum is religious teaching. It is not merely an Indian cultural display. That said, there is absolutely no pressure from staff to take any additional information or spend any more time if you are ready to leave.
Great experience and they treat you great. You can learn a lot and see the exhibition while you listen to a narrator with lovely music in the background. Hare Krishna!

column2: Bhagavat Gita essence presented as a treat to the senses
column3: I was initially sceptical about visiting this museum as I did not want to be bored with an endless spiritual monologue or read a bunch of plaques. I was treated to a pleasant surprise. The museum had exhibits which were finely crafted and decorated with elaborate colours and beautiful background props. The lighting was perfect and complimented nicely with the playback audio.The message of the Bhagavad Gita was presented concisely retaining the essence in a way that my 7-year-old daughter could also appreciate both the sacred scripture and also the skill of the artists who put it all together. I would highly recommend it to everyone and especially to kids.
Very nice museum went with family. Lot of learning. Music and effects used are very nice. Recommend everyone to go.

column2: Beautiful journey through the ancient scriptures of India.
column3: My six-year old son and I loved the experience. The diorama museum is so well made and beautifully explains the nature of the soul. We are not our bodies. Great insight and illustrations. Thank you so much!
A beautiful spiritual experience. Very enlightening. The art is magnificent and the audio and video is very well done.

I was a really cool experience to see the Bhagavad Gita museum. It started like a journey and took me to a process of seeing what truly Hinduism is. The good news is the price is so cheap, so every one can go and gain some experience about it.
So well curated, beautiful installations. The gentleman who was our guide was amazing.Try the yummy food next door as well!
A Los Angeles gem! Wonderful staff and beautiful dioramas. These are works of art. Will return to experience again.

column2: Incredibly glad we found this place!
column3: Brings the geeta to life in a totally new way -- going through this incredibly unique experience was re-inspiring, beautiful, insightful -- I would definitely recommend to anyone who is able to visit.The ideas expressed in the geeta and so aptly displayed here are so beneficial to humanity as a whole and individuals themselves to be reminded we are one and not this body or mind but the lasting soul that is only a part and reflection of the great soul -- none should restrict themselves from this experience.
This was a great little spiritual museum to check out and very impressive. I think for those familiar with the themes or not, still can learn from seeing this after checking out the Temple.

I had an Incredible visit. Topics from the Gitaare presented through incredable real art and multimedia format. It a life time experience one must endure. I enjoyed every moment that I spend there and I will go back again.

One of the best experiences in recent timesWe are from mathura vrindavan but not seen something like this before. The museum displays the entire concept of bhagvat gita in such a simple manner with the help of amazing visualsA must for anyone visiting LA

Visiting the Bhagavad-gita Museum last Saturday was a very inspiring experience. One doesn't have to be a Hindu or a yoga practitioner to appreciate the museum; you will enjoy this if you have a curious nature. Our guide, Radha-Krishna, knowing that I am interested in yogic thought and history, stopped by between each presentation/installation to explain what we had seen in greater detail and to answer any questions. He was very kind and informative. As for the installations themselves, they are beautifully detailed animatronic scenes, accompanied with narration that even a child can understand. Visitors will learn the story of the Bhagavad-Gita and leave with much to consider, if they choose. We finished our visit at Govinda's next door - delicious Indian buffet at $8 a person - a lovely way to digest what we had just seen and heard.

The museum is very well done. It provides the visitor's with a great experience. The mini shows inside the museum tells us more about the importance and teachings of the Bhagvad Gita. The approx time we spent in the museum was 45 minutes. Entry fee is 10$
As someone who has read several commentaries on Bhagavad Gita and has spent much time among Vaishnavas, I must say that this was a soul-stirring exhibit and lovely part of my trip to LA.
The museum was fascinating! The dioramas brought the story to life and made it so memorable. I learned so much today!

One of the best places to learn more about the Bhagavad Gita. Great Light show and a totally immersive experience. One doesn't realise and 45 minutes just go by. However, the sound sometimes is not clear and it might be a little difficult to hear exactly what is been communicated about the teachings from the Book.Over all a great experience! Prepare to be enlightened!
We visited there yesterday, and were surprised by the high quality of art and interesting explanations about the legacy and history of Indian sacred gods.An interesting experience.

ISKCON LA is a wonderful place to visit and do not neglect the museum. It is more than a retelling of the Gita or interesting scenes to look at and move on. Instead it is it‚Äôs own experience of word, sight, and music that found resonance in my heart and made me glad to be alive and on the journey to God realization. Highly recommended!

This museum was an amazing investment of my time! Beautiful dioramas with a great and unique audiovisual experience. I would highly recommend for anyone curious about spirituality and Krishna Consciousness. It was like a 4D movie. Clearly they spent so much time making this. It is worth much more money than the $10 they charge.
A very in depth look at life from the Bhagavad Gita. It takes you through the process of life in a visual way that helps understand the meaning of life.
This was a very unique and interesting kind of experience! Would highly recommend this to anyone traveling to LA and want something new and refreshing.

I heard about this from a friend and visited during the summer break with my family. Very friendly staff and a highly surcharged spiritual ambience! There was no waiting time. The overall experience was extremely enlightening as we went through multiple stations enjoying the audio visual stimulation. The price is so reasonable considering the quality of the dioramas and the wealth of information presented. A must see for everyone in Los Angeles!!!
A Los Angeles gem. Kind and patient staff. Fabulous dioramas. This is definitely a work of art. Can't wait to come back and view it after the restoration work.

It is truly a rare, life altering experience. You will go through a tour on consecutive exhibitions, which will make you question yourself and get a clue on many fundamental matters that most of us simply ignore. Enjoy the tour without any bias and preconception and by the end of the tour you will be a better version of yourself.

I often find that in Los Angeles the most wondrous of places are hidden in plain sight. I drove by this museum and cultural center for many years before venturing in. I am so glad I did so. This beautiful museum, both haunting and enlightening, will change you. The visual impact of the these beautifully rendered dolls and the power of the message will compel you to seek more. It hard to believe this museum is 40+ years old. Its vibrance remains timeless. Thank you to the people who lovingly maintain it. I look forward to returning.
This is a very nice experience where you get hear about summary of Bhagavad Gita. Very peaceful atmosphere, I came out with a calm mind after visiting. Not to be missed.

This diorama museum is a hidden gem in LA. The dioramas are beautiful. The sculptures are exceptionally crafted and the light show and animatronic are awesome! I had a wonderful time at the exhibit. It was an enlightening experience full of wisdom that I will take with me on my life journey. Next time I visit I‚Äôll be bringing my family. Also, the Govindas restaurant was a nice treat after :)

As someone who struggles with death the dioramas and explanations were comforting. There is so much to know about the Gita and this display answered more questions. Information is now deeper into my brain. I highly recommend this to all seekers, you will not regret the experience

column2: A most Stunning and Powerful Experience!
column3: I have always had an interest in ancient India and Yoga, and when I learned that there was this incredible Museum in LA that takes one to the very ancient sources of both, I knew I had to visit.Well, let me tell you, I am still feeling kind of overwhelmed with a deep happiness with what I discovered there, which, believe it or not, actually awakened something in me that I have been seeking for decades.I don't want to reveal everything here (it's really not possible to anyway), but all I can say is that if you would like to have one of the most, if not the most, positive life-changing experiences, I most highly recommend visiting the incredible Bhagavad-gita Museum. While the Getty may interest you, this will change you!
One must experience this for him/her self..It is mind boggling..beyond words..the details achieved are incredible and highly enlightening.

‚ÄúThrough life-size sculptured scenes, you will be treated with visual journey which is enlightening all in a 45-minute journey of the top most of transcendental knowledge of Bhakti Yoga, the Bhagavad-gita.‚ÄùIt was a great way to introduce my kids to a new culture. At first they were a bit afraid of the sculptures and how they portrait death and reincarnation. But by the end they were so happy they were there.After your visit dont miss next door vegan bufe and the store. We loved it!

I come to the vegetarian restaurant here often and the people are always nice and friendly. I saw a invitation to the museum and decided to go. Only for a small donation i went through the museum and it shares the Krsna Consciousness philosophy. It was mind expanding and informative. Definitely recommend it!üòÅ

column2: It was the best museum I have ever visited!
column3: It's just an amazing place, so beautiful and interesting to watch. I was so impressed. You pay just 10$ to enter, it's 1000% worth it.

if you are a collector or just a admirer of what has to be car art this place is a boggle. Seriously fine cars, rare cars and lots of them. This has to be a must on any car nuts bucket list. Need a car to get there, appropriately in the City that cars built.

This was a wonderful presentation well worth the time spent. This inspires thought into life and its purpose also. Nicely done to give amazing experience to visitors. There is an organic natural food restaurant (Govindas) right next to this and that has wonderful Buffet for vegetarians and vegans.
It takes one to a different world and provides a different perspective to this world. It is a great first time thing to do.

The museum of the Bagavad - Gita is inspiring to ones spiritual life. The story and dioramas on display is amazing in awe. As a first visit being a devotee is soul changing and has gotten oneself of confidence and happiness to spread the Hare Krsna Movement to others.

This museum is unlike any other I‚Äôve seen. As one wanders throigh the beautifully decorated dioraramas a complete explanation of both the material world and spiritual world is given. Perhaps one of the coolest spots in LA.
Great place to bring your family and friends. Highly recommend check out the temple and the restaurant as well.
Wow! the entire museum is a work of transcendental art and a spiritual pilgrimage! This was my third time coming here with friends! Dioramas like this are not seen anywhere else. Enjoy!
I‚Äôve never seen anything like it. It is great! It gives you a very effective crash course in The philosophy contained in the Bhagavad Gita. It is very vivid and shocking.

This is a totally unique experience and chance to see what this life is all about. We are getting an introduction to spiritual life and devotion to god. I recommend everyone to make the opportunity to see this exhibit!

Our visit to the Diorama Museum was nothing short of incredible. We were welcomed as family by Radhe Krishna, the museum guide. We loved every bit of the museum tour and our two year old hasn‚Äôt stopped talking about it for days. Thank you so much for such a beautiful and heartwarming experience. Don‚Äôt forget to visit Govindas for a delicious meal after your tour. Haribol!

A beautiful telling Hindu mystical philosophy in the traditional Indian diorama style, a tradition going back to the 1800's. The museum is one of those rare quirky treasures hidden in the backrooms and backstreets of Los Angeles. Definitely worth a visit.

column2: An enlightening visual portrayal of the gist of Gita
column3: The museum depicts the main teachings of Gita using beautiful visuals,succint narrative and in depth explanation of each teaching.

This is undoubtedly the best 3D experience I've had. Really mesmerizing. The whole philosophy of Bhagavad Gita is succinctly explained. Every year I visit LA, I make sure not to miss this museum. It is always a great delight watching this 3D show. Beats all other shows.
Very well organized, The museum is an enlightenment to all ages, the diorama presentation is like watching a movie, will recommend it to one and all

our experience was memorable. The museum was awesome, a lot of effort and detail in were visible in the exhibits.the main theme of the museum represents how life changes from one form of species to other species , how we can end suffering by practicing YOGA.interesting to know GOD is ONE but different names ALLAH, JEHOVAH , JESUSthe sound and light effects were fantastic ....mind blowing .options for authentic food , reasonable price , vegan / vegetarianshopping / Gift shop has varieties of books , cloths , personal items
Excellent presentation. Important Bhagavad slokas well presented. Every year i attend LA radha yatra. Every time i go i won't miss this museum. Must go with family.

Everything was so amazing, and organised, the time spent at each station was just right, not too lengthy or too short. The language used was simple but yet conveyed the message and my 8 year old daughter loved it, I think it is a good place to stop by especially for the kids, as they are able to picturize the things they have read and heard from the Bhagavat Gita

This diorama museum is definitely a mystical and magical experience worth having. It will take you to another world through a series of beautiful presentations of the Gita, that showcase the most beautiful and detailed dioramas of Lord Krsna and his associates and more. Initially I did not know what was in the museum. Once I was inside I could not be happier and I immediately immersed myself in the beauty right before my eyes. The detail and beauty on each of these dioramas is a testament of love and dedication by the devotees that created them. It is a must have experience!WARNING: excitement, goosebumps and tearing up are all part of this incredible experience. üòä

This is an excellent trip through the story spoken from Krishna to his friend Arjuna on the battlefeild of Kuruksetra. Be ready to be fully immersed in a spiritual journey that will blow your mind and awaken your soul.
This place was such a surprise because I never knew it existed. It's also quiet impressive for the size of this place to pack so much insightful information to a spiritual life.
This was incredible! I enjoyed it very much. The artwork was amazing, and I loved the presentation of the philosophy. Haribol!

column2: Intriguing Representation of the Real Self!
column3: Nestled right between a super nice Vegetarian Restaurant and a Bhakti yoga temple, this place is worth the 45 mins tour time. One place not to miss in LA. Coming from Disney Land, we felt this museum should be actually present in Anaheim, as it perfectly complements it.The diorama's take us through a journey of our own self, but through the words of the Gita (the world renowned book on the complete aspect of Yoga). The light show and the diorama dialog, are extremely interesting. A perfect halt for any visitor in LA. Would love to come back here.
The dioramas are beautifully constructed and the audio is also well done. I loved all the little details. Worth the visit.
The process is good and the design of the introduction is excellent. You can learn many things from this tour. Another suggestion is going with a friend.

This place is amazing! Such a sacred place that really captures the readings of the bhagavad gita. Being devoted to the supreme spiritual being is a life changing experience. It brings you closer to yourself by educating you about the connection of the soul and god.
This museum is awesome! The artistic presentation is phenomenal. The story that unfolds in the course of the eleven super intricate life-size dioramas is very engaging and inspiring.

The Bhagavad Gita Museum has always been one of my favorite attractions in Los Angeles. Lord Krishna and Arjuna, Srila Prabhupada, and all of the dioramas are transcendental. Thank you for an awesome experience.

It is simply outstanding, a phenomenal experience of what our life is all about. Bhagwad Gita is a sacred text for people around the world at the same time it is Spiritual Road Map of LIFE. Many scholars like Emerson, and Gandhi also took shelter of this great Epic. In this museum massive work has been done to accomplish the essence of Bhagwad Gita in a very timely manner. My entire family visited the museum and I recommend it very high on my list.

column2: Once is a lifetime experience - Don't miss it.
column3: Absolutely amazing experience. Will definitely go there again and recommend to others. This museum is not specific to any religion but the revelation of "truth" and "science of self realization" using technology and dioramas is simply mind boggling. The attendant on duty was courteous and exceptionally knowledgeable in the field of spiritual science and was very accommodating to all our questions. The next door super awesome vegetarian/vegan restaurant is certainly a PLUS. The entire experience was totally value for money.
unforgettable pictures of dioramam are still in my mind. The temple is very beautiful inside and vegan food in the restorant is great.

column2: The best time ever in LA !
column3: The Fate Museum in LA is truly a place I love . I‚Äôll go there every time that I amIn Lis Angeles. It was a real eye opener, a soul searching trip and a glories place to be. I‚Äôm telling everyone I know to go have this great experience !I‚Äôm surprise there isn‚Äôt a line out the door to Venice blvd.KeepUp the great work. See you next time I‚Äôm in LA.‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏èAcross the board

My girlfriend and I had a phenomenal time learning more about spirituality and growing in our knowledge of Self. We are so very grateful and blessed to have experienced this. And the food next door is PERFECT!! And low cost. I love this place and can‚Äôt wait to take all my friends back.‚ÄúThe only true religion is one that teaches us how to Love‚Äù

Out of this world dioramas! The handmade artistic craftsmanship in every exibit along with the interactive audio and visual effects create a uniquily profound experience. The museum guide was soo ooo Knowledgeable! We had so many questions, and he answered them all so eloquently.... Undoubtedly, a Hidden Gem in Los Angeles..

column2: Ancient Yoga philosophy in Stunning Animation
column3: Great way to present ancient philosophy and wisdom in an animated and captivating way,Great exhibitions, guide, artwork, and majestic sculptures!Must for those interested in philosophy of the Vedas!
Was a very well made and developed show, the museum in more of an explanation and story of the Bhagavadgita. It has amazing voice over and also an exceptional display of lights for the exhibits.

The Diorama-museum of Bhagavad-gita is an uplifting and all-engaging spiritual experience that brings the audience into the deep knowledge of ancient India, knowledge of our eternal relationship with the Supreme.

The Bhagavad Gita museum truly is a hidden jewel in the midst of west Los Angeles. Never have I seen something quite like it. Although created in the late 1970‚Äôs. The message is still clear and awe-inspiring. It seems that this philosophy stands the test of time.
This is a museum like no other - a fascinating, informative and enjoyable 45 minutes or so. Well worth a visit.

It is an experience of a life time, I was thrilled with the way they present the most ancient wisdom texts from India, in the most understandable unique way, a must visit for anyone and everyone. The people are nice and intellectual to engage you in a meaningful conversation about the all types of Yoga.

I have been living for many years in Culver City and never knew about this wonderful informative museum.We are so blessed to have new Dwarka temple in Culver City and the Bhagavad Gita museum to see the knowledge of this sacred book Bhagavad Gita as it is.Visit the beautiful temple, and enjoy Govinda‚Äôs restaurant all the food made by Devotiees ..has been blessed.above the restaurant you‚Äôll find beautiful clothing and gifts, make sure you pick up a spiritual book before you leave.

Try the vegetarian restaurant and visit the temple. All in one block.You‚Äôll feel blessed.Also on Sundays you can join lord Krishna‚Äôs awesome devotees at the temple‚Äôs Sunday Feast and chant and worship and dance and eat and laugh.

It's a hidden gem. I was quite surprised by the philosophy and underlying message it presented. The visual and audio are very vivid. It felt like walking through the pages of Bhagavat gita. Must see if u love good philosophy. Even if you are not religious, it make you think deep about who we are and why are we living this life even though our life is short. I love the guy working there and is very knowledgeable in this.

This experience begins with some beautiful and thought provoking art in the lobby. Then! Such sweet people!! Everyone I encountered was so welcoming and warm. Not to mention attentive. I was prepped for what I thought might be another "museum experience"... Now, I've read the Bhagavad Gita a few times, but I have never seen it come alive in the way it does in LA. Like the spiritual text, the museum sheds light on self-understanding, takes you to new heights, and touches your heart. GO! GO NOW! :)
unique explanation, I was involved in Krishna consciousness earlier and that museum gave me a better understanding through visual pictures and sounds!

column2: Informative museum for children and adult
column3: Visiting this museum and learning about Hinduism philosophy of life is enjoyable and takes 2 or 3 hours.The presenter and guide is very knowledgeable and makes the experience quite fruitful.I really recommend to visit at least once.

column2: Museum of Knowledge & Wisdom in bustling metropolis
column3: A couple days ago I had the privilege to unexpectedly visit this gem of a place with family to experience the awesome ambiance and settings explaining the science which is not found in contemporary times anywhere else in the USA and in the world.The sculptures, music and narration was very lucid to make a total new person understand the science of soul in a very clean narrative.This place is adjacent to the ISKCON Los Angeles temple and the person at the counter was very courteous and genuinely friendly with a hearty smile and welcomed us explaining the route inside the diorama museum. The overall experience took us about 40 minutes and time flied while we were inside and my 6 year old daughter understood the words of wisdom explained in the background of wonderful art and music.I personally think the whole experience is provided at a very down to earth cost for imparting the knowledge that could save the soul. Strongly recommend the place to everyone.Don't miss the Govinda's restaurant next door for healthy sattvic food.

column2: A unique and hidden gem in LA!
column3: In the chaos and superficiality of LA is this wonderful museum/experience where you can go and find out about something deeper and fulfilling. I learned so much in my first visit. I will definitely be back again! Highly recommend this place to everyone!

Just a few days ago I had went to this diorama-Museum with a few friends. For many of them it was there first time. They were all moved and spoke highly of their experience. One, a dear friend had mentioned that there was one exibit that even brought him to tears. A true gem and masterpiece presentation of Bhagavad Gita. I recommend to all!

column2: A great place to get a 45 min intro to the Bhagavad Gita
column3: This is an amazing and fascinating museum about the Bhagavad Gita -- unique in my opinion.I was very impressed with the audio/visual of each exhibit that explained a *lot* of text material in a very succinct manner!IMO, this is a must visit place if you are in the Venice Beach/Culver City area.Suggest visiting in the afternoon so that you can also visit the temple and see the beautifully deities (altar opens around 4:30PM).Hare Krsna

column2: Wish I could spend weekends in that museum!
column3: I first went to the Bhagavad-gita museum some time in 2000s. I felt so impressed by the work. Each diorama presents a specific messages and carries its own personal mood. By the time you come out you feel like your heart and mind have opened up to the message it presents. I remember my sister, after taking the tour, walked out full of inspiration. It's just very special and captivating. My most favorite exhibits are the last two. They are so beautiful and personal, you really don't want the experience to end.First time definitely makes you go back for more.

My experience here has always been a good one. I have visited on multiple occasions and Everytime it brings me such Joy and awe. Definitely something out of the ordinary. If you are looking for something counter to the usual, this is the place for you. Its roots in ancient philosophy and breathe taking visuals will leave you questioning your very existence... :)

column2: Wish All Museums Were This Way!
column3: This is one of the most dramatic, artistic and inspiring displays you will ever experience. There are gorgeous dioramas and you enter into a journey of higher conscious experience through sight and sound. You will surely be motivated to dive into the ancient text Bhagavad Gita after this.

This is such a great museum not only for devotees of Krishna Cnsciousness but also for anybody who would like to get a taste of what spiritual realm is all about. From birth to death and in between, this museum gives an incredible knowledge of how our souls develop and carry on to the next level of consciousness and hopefully someday ultimately reach Vaikunta.Thank you for offering this beautiful service and the deep experience to the world.Namaste.

This museum is one of its' kind.For those who are interested in Hinduism, in India, in the teachings of the Vedas (and in particular of the Bhagavad-Gita), the Diorama-museum is perfect.You walk through life-size exhibits - dioramas that are carved with attention to the minutest detail.By the time you walk out of the museum, you've literally walked *through* the Bhagavad-Gita, equipped with a basic understanding of its fundamental tenets.Entertaining, and yet educational.Cyril WohrerMst, Oxford University

Absolutely my favorite place ever! A "never forget" experience! Not knowing what to expect finaly it turned out to be an amazing spiritual discovery. Walking throught the museum you get answers to like "Who am I?", "Who is God?", "What is this matterial world arround us?", "What is my aim in this world?" and "What is karma?". Who needs more than that? :) If you wish to get a better understanding of how you can get on a path of self-realization this is a right place to get start to educate yourself. Special thanks to Radha Krisna prabhu who was so kind to spend time with my family and I by adding more details of what we learned in the museum by answering to our questions.Also don't miss Govinda restaurant located right beside the museum.
I had no idea the ISKCON temple here in LA had a museum like this. My experience left me feeling inspired and looking forward to further exibits like this one.

column2: Rocked me to my core - A LIFE CHANGING EXPERIENCE.
column3: The museum answers these questions definitively: Who am I? Why do I exist? What does my future hold in-store for me?Human society has made fantastic progress in the fields of material comfort, education and economic development. But there is a pinprick somewhere in the social body at large, and therefore there are large-scale quarrels‚Äî even over small issues. There is need of a clue as to how humanity can become one in peace, friendship and prosperity with a common cause. The present disparities in human society are due to lack of spiritual principles in a godless civilization. The science presented in the Bhagavad-gita Museum will fulfill this need. It is a cultural presentation for the re-spiritualization of the entire human society.

After I heard that there was a Bhagavad Gita museum I knew I had to see it, but it was nothing like anything I could have ever imagined. It brought tears to my eyes. So inspiring. Everyone should see this,devotees and karmis alike.
I loved this Diorama! It was entertaining, aesthetically pleasing, and spiritually awakening! Everyone should go to this as well as the temple and Govindas!

column2: A Magical Gem of a Museum
column3: On a little out of the way street, tucked quietly almost out if sight is a gorgeous, surprising little gem of a museum that gives a perfect overview of the Bhagavad Gita in a series of beautiful dioramas with music, lighting and incredible staging that grows more impressive with every step you take.If you know enough to be looking at this review, don‚Äôt miss this museum!

Was there during my summer vacation. The Museum is absolutely amazing. It's really great!!!! I have never seen something like this in the whole world. Highly recommended.p.s. next to the museum there is temple and cafe - great vegetarian buffet!

I truly was fascinated by this animatronics museum. It is truly amazing and I highly recommend it. For only $10, it is a spectacular and inexpensive attraction. Then grab some wonderful food at the Govinda's cafe.

The minute the narration starts and the lights get turned on, you get captivated by the realistic figures wich resemble as if one is actually is part of what is happening. Such spiritual, unique experience cannot be found anywhere but in New Dwarka's Bhagavad Gita museum.

Come to this museum to learn about the Hindu Bhagavad-Gita writings about the benefits of yoga. Dioramas are beautiful and elaborate accompanied by highly dramatic narration. Check out the gift shop and yummy looking cafe next door. Truly a wonderful, culturally enriching experience right in West LA !!! Not to be missed !!!

The 'museum' is a journey into a series of immersive multimedia chambers both beautiful and repulsive, highlighting aspects of the epic story of the Bhagavad Gita and the 8 limbs of yoga. I cannot recommend this museum enough, you will likely never experience anything quite like it.

We had a great morning at the Bhagavad Gita museum. The exhibits showed how the spirt and the material are separate and how the ancient Indian vedic texts describe the human journey.Highly recommend, it takes about an hour and there is a fantastic vegetarian restaurant on site which opens at 11am. üòä

The museum is tucked down a corridor between the Krishna Consciousness Temple and Govinda's Restaurant. I've lived in Culver City for 2 years, and I never noticed it. On the outside it seems small, but the dioramas and accompanying audio make for an extravagant cinematic experience. The displays are large and detailed, each with its own light show to compliment the narration and music. It takes only 45 minutes to get through the whole museum, and I guarantee no matter your religious beliefs you will leave feeling enlightened and educated. It was well worth the $10 entry fee.

column2: Insightful exhibit and great temple/ restaurant
column3: The dioramas were only one of few great activities in this Hare Krishna campus/ temple. There was also their beautiful temple, exotic gift shop and restaurant. So made for a good few hours for the spiritual seeker.
